runners.comment: Showed promise on debut but safely held in six subsequent starts; eased in grade
runners.name: Blazing Beam
runners.owner: Roger Chan Tse Man & Bosco Chan
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on debut but safely held in six subsequent starts; today's ease in grade still not enough to tempt.

runners.comment: Shaped better when a fair sixth on reappearance three weeks ago; more still needed.
runners.name: General Smart
runners.owner: Alex Chau Man Lok, Jack Chan Hoi Et Al
runners.spotlight: Little to recommend last season but shaped better when a fair sixth on reappearance three weeks ago; more still needed.

runners.comment: Placed twice in higher-grade company this season and well drawn today; good chance
runners.name: Nebraskan
runners.owner: Kenneth Lam Sze Ken, Timothy Junior Lam & T Fok Kwong Hang

prev_owners.owner: Tfi Diamond Syndicate & Mrs L Fung

runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but unlucky not to score when third in two narrow finishes in October; eased in grade and well drawn today; good chance.

runners.comment: Scored over this trip on Sha Tin dirt last term but safely held in both starts this season
runners.name: Robot Knight
runners.spotlight: Scored over this trip on Sha Tin dirt last term but safely held in both starts this season; should be faring better off this mark.

runners.comment: Recent efforts suggest a breakthrough win might be near; wide draw a big negative today
runners.name: Happy Boys
runners.owner: David Tse Sik Hung, Allison Tse Pui Shan & Q Tse Pui Ching
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in defeat this season and has shown a bit more since dropping into this lowly grade; no surprise if he seriously threatens soon but wide draw a bug negative today.

runners.comment: Runner-up here on his penultimate outing and again ran well six days ago; shortlisted
runners.name: Sky Song
runners.owner: Kwan Kin Man, Dora Kwan Man Ting & Bryan Kwan Hon Ming
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D last season; runner-up here on his penultimate outing and again ran well six days ago; firmly on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Back in the mix when second over 7f at Sha Tin two runs ago but disappointed last time
runners.name: Team Happy
runners.spotlight: Back in the mix when second over 7f at Sha Tin two runs ago but disappointed last time and needs to rebound again.

runners.comment: Has the inside draw today but needs to bounce back from a poor run
runners.name: Woodfire Champ
runners.spotlight: Ended last season on a high and returned with a respectable effort in September; has the inside draw today but needs to bounce back from a poor run two months ago.

runners.comment: Encouraging seasonal return over this trip in September but form has dipped since
runners.name: Brilliant Fire
runners.spotlight: Encouraging seasonal return over this trip in September but form has dipped since; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Glimmers of hope last season but two starts since making his return have been very poor
runners.name: Concorde Star
runners.owner: Philip Yu Chi Wai & Dr Jennie Peterson Yu
runners.spotlight: Glimmers of hope last season but two starts since making his return have been very poor; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Winless last season but has been hinting at a breakthrough this time around; considered
runners.name: Sonic Boom
runners.owner: George Lee Hing Fai, Wong Che Leung Et Al
runners.spotlight: Winless last season but has been hinting at a breakthrough this time around; one to keep on side off his current mark.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but ran well when making the frame over 5f here three weeks ago
runners.name: Ever Smart
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but ran well when making the frame over 5f here three weeks ago, and has previously gone close off higher marks.

runners.comment: Yet to make the frame in 12 local starts, the last twice this season
runners.name: Rich Horse
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the frame in 12 local starts and has been safely held in two outings since making his reappearance last month; can only be watched.

runners.comment: Not the force of old but returned to winning ways over C&D two runs back
runners.name: Podium
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old but returned to winning ways over C&D two runs back and has made the frame off new mark since; considered each-way.

runners.comment: 12-race losing run brings him down in class; his efforts this season have been lacklustre
runners.name: Noble Pursuit
runners.spotlight: Drops into Class 4 for the first time since a C&D victory 11 months ago; he has since won twice in Class 3 (including over C&D) but is on a 12-race losing run; his performances have been laboured this term and this lesser grade is no guarantee he will be revitalised.

runners.breeder: M W Gething, I N & Mrs S K Gillatt
runners.comment: Possible pacesetter as his wins have come at 6f/7f; best at Sha Tin and has stamina doubts
runners.name: Fun Together
runners.spotlight: Tackles this track for just the second time, having dropped away in a 6f contest here last month; strong-finishing final furlongs have been the hallmark of his five career wins (6f/7f Sha Tin), but four attempts at 1m have seen him fade at the close; opened season with two promising efforts (7f) but two subsequent defeats have been poor; could lead in a race without much natural speed.

runners.comment: Two C&D wins; 7lb above last victory, but has run well in defeat off this mark last twice
runners.name: Amazing Award
runners.owner: Chan Kwok Yuen, Terence Lun Tin Yeu & Paul Li Cheuk Wai
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season; he's 7lb higher than for his last victory, but has run well in defeat off this mark on his last two appearances; while ideally he needs to drop a little in the weights, he has every chance of going close again.

runners.comment: C&D specialist; won last time but has never doubled up; needs luck from off the pace
runners.name: Turin Warrior
runners.spotlight: Picked up each of his four wins over C&D, including last time out when he came from nearly last to first to lead on the line; he's up 5lb for that nose success but scored off this mark in January; yet to record back-to-back wins and always requires some luck when making up his ground.

runners.comment: Ran well both starts here; stall 12 and 0-12 in Hong Kong but place claims on latest runs
runners.name: Prestige Ricky

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai British EBF "Confined" Maiden Stakes (C & G) (No More Than 2 Runs) (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a messy race but Accumulate got the job done which is the main thing. He could run again this year but we'll have to see how he comes out of this - Roger Varian, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won twice in Britain (7f/8f) in 2023 but is 0-12 in Hong Kong; kept on through the final furlong and not beaten far over C&D on his last two starts, his only outings at this venue; now dropped 2lb, he is capable of claiming a share of the prize-money, although stall 12 is not ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He could start off at Ascot on May 10 in a Class 2 handicap over seven furlongs and we'll see if he develops into a horse for the Britannia. He's that kind of horse and hasn't done much wrong so far. 25-04-24

runners.comment: Bled when failing in hat-trick bid last term; needed return run; major player for top yard
runners.name: Ping Hai Comet
runners.spotlight: Had substantial blood in his trachea after flopping in a hat-trick bid in June after wins here (1m3f) and at Sha Tin (1m); needed last month's return and landed a trial this month in good style; 8lb up on last winning mark but has more to offer; expected to press the pace; on the shortlist.

runners.comment: There are bright bits on his CV and Zac Purton booked; has claims in the company
runners.name: Absolute Awakened
runners.spotlight: There is one good run and two fair efforts on his six-race CV but he has lacked tactical speed at times; dropped another 2lb and Zac Purton booked for first time; represents shrewd trainer and can't be dismissed in this company.

runners.comment: First-time blinkers and longer trip may help; has not shown enough to support
runners.name: Great Legacy
runners.owner: Kenneth Fung King Keung, Patrick Fung King Hung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Fung Wing Chung, Kenneth Fung King Keung Et Al

runners.spotlight: Has lacked the pace to get competitive in three sprints (5f/6f); takes a jump in distance and a 2lb fall in the weights, while a hood is replaced by first-time blinkers; his paternal family boasts speed, but his dam's side suggests he can stay; that's not enough to warrant support, but worth seeing how he fares with another day in mind.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner around this time last year but his efforts this time around don't inspire
runners.name: Prince Alex
runners.spotlight: Landed consecutive narrow C&D victories at around this time last year; has shown almost nothing since, with eight unplaced efforts on the bounce; he's on a mark 3lb below that of his last win, but needs to turn a corner.

runners.comment: In the money 4-8 here; two placed efforts over C&D read well but below best this term
runners.name: Joyful Prosperity
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Silas S S Yang & Michelle H Y Yang
runners.spotlight: While his three wins have all be achieved at Sha Tin, his eight appearances here have seen him in the money four times; placed twice in five C&D outings and on some efforts can be given a bright chance; has been below his best on both runs this campaign.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but on a long losing stretch; well treated but that's for a good reason
runners.name: Setanta
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See

prev_owners.owner: Aquis Farm, C J Barham Et Al

runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who has run better than his final position might suggest in three of his four runs this season; another 2lb drop in his mark leaves him 12lb below the rung from which he last scored; he's an 8yo who needs things to fall right from off the pace and is on a lengthy losing streak.

runners.comment: A record of 1-41 in Hong Kong and 0-14 over C&D reveals much about his prospects
runners.name: Kasa Papa

prev_owners.owner: Dynamic Syndications Racing, J R Carter Et Al

runners.spotlight: An 8yo who is 1-41 in Hong Kong and 0-14 over C&D; failed by a neck when runner-up last time (1m1f) and he could be prominent which might serve him well with doubts about what pace they might go; his overall record tempers faith in his chance.

runners.comment: C&D second three runs back gives him a chance but he's 0-8 after two lesser efforts
runners.name: Conspiracy Witness
runners.owner: Arthur Antonio Da Silva, Betty Da Silva & Teresa Da Silva
runners.spotlight: Yet to oblige in eight outings; gave notice he would be up to winning soon when a close second to Super Unicorn over C&D in October; two below-par efforts last month put that thought on hold; has something to prove.

runners.comment: C&D runner-up to Beauty Glory two runs back was a fair effort; disappointed since
runners.name: Aeroinvincible
runners.spotlight: Both his successes were obtained at Sha Tin (7f), with the latest coming 14 months ago; his C&D second to Beauty Glory two runs back puts him in the mix; a little disappointing last time and questions remain.

runners.breeder: R N Cunningham & Haunui Farm Lp
runners.comment: Won on dirt last season but needs to prove he's fully effective on turf
runners.name: Shanghai Style
runners.spotlight: Gained a 1m dirt win at Sha Tin last season; runner-up over that C&D in October but needs to prove he's fully effective on this surface.

runners.comment: On long losing run but strong signs of resurgence this season; in the mix
runners.name: Quantum Patch

prev_owners.owner: David Spratt & Sean Jones & Mrs Lynne Lyons

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Bingo Bronson is a nice horse. He's very much a baby, he loved that ground, and I would say you won't see the best of him till next year - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.spotlight: On long losing run but strong signs of resurgence this season; no surprise if he's in the thick of things.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner last term; current mark demands a career best
runners.name: The Azure
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Ho Pui Lun & Mr & Mrs Norman Tang Fai Ng
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner last term; fair fifth two runs ago but again held last time, career best needed to win this.

runners.comment: Got off the mark over 1m at Sha Tin in September but has struggled off revised mark since
runners.name: Good Good
runners.owner: Michael Ng Chi Lam & Gloria Ng Wong Yee Man
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over 1m at Sha Tin in September but has struggled off revised mark since; more needed.

runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.comment: 42-1 shot on debut over C&D last month and ran to expectations
runners.name: Justify Yourself
runners.spotlight: 42-1 shot on debut over C&D last month and ran to expectations; swaps blinkers for cheekpieces; likely one for the longer term.

runners.comment: 0-10 in Hong Kong but did well to finish second over C&D from stall 10 last month
runners.name: Ragga Bomb

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Gleneagles Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ragga Bomb is a weak horse and that could be it for this year. He will strengthen up an awful lot for next year and seven is his trip - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: 0-10 in Hong Kong but did well to finish second over C&D from stall 10 last month and might be boosted by first-time cheekpieces today; one to note.

runners.comment: Landed third local win over C&D in October; still well treated on older form
runners.name: Celtic Times
runners.spotlight: Landed third local win over C&D in October; held off higher mark since but has scored off this rating before.

runners.comment: Made frame over 7f last month and 1m probably suits better but others appeal more
runners.name: Winning Data
runners.owner: Dr Steven Li Siu Lung, Cheng Lap Yin Et Al
runners.spotlight: Progressive early in career but winless since February; made the frame over 7f at Sha Tin last month and ought to be suited by this return to 1m but others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Dual Sha Tin winner late last season but yet to really fire in three runs this term
runners.name: World Hero
runners.spotlight: Dual Sha Tin winner late last season but yet to really fire in three runs since returning in October; more needed.

runners.comment: Finished strongly for second over 6f two runs ago; Purton booked for first attempt at 1m
runners.name: Quick Contribution
runners.spotlight: Below form over 7f last time but finished strongly for second over 6f two starts ago and Zac Purton is an interesting booking for this first attempt at 1m.

runners.comment: Made frame over C&D three times in recent months and continues to edge down the weights
runners.name: Our Lucky Glory
runners.spotlight: Without a win since April 2024 but has made the frame over C&D three consecutive times in recent months and continues to edge down the weights; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Ended last campaign with all-the-way C&D win; up in grade after layoff
runners.name: Shinkansen
runners.spotlight: Ended last campaign with all-the-way C&D win but has 5lb rise, 167-day layoff and rise in grade to overcome.

runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Ended last season under a cloud and hasn't offered much in three outings this term
runners.name: Matsu Victor
runners.owner: Lau Ying Kin & Lau Mok Yuen Kee
runners.spotlight: Ended last season under a cloud and hasn't offered much in three outings this term; revival needed.

runners.comment: 6f winner on penultimate outing; held since; moves up in grade today
runners.name: Somelovefromabove
runners.owner: Ling Wai Sun & Michael Ling Siu Ming
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward with a breakthrough win over 6f here on penultimate outing; held off revised mark six days ago and now steps up in trip.

runners.comment: Back to scene of six C&D wins and down in class; first-time visor may spark return to form
runners.name: Sugar Sugar
runners.spotlight: Raced only at Sha Tin this term and is 0-13 there; returns here with six C&D wins on his record; drops to this grade for first time since winning under top weight in January 2023 from this same stall (4); wears first-time visor; no surprise if he bounces back.

runners.comment: Needs luck from off the pace but C&D winner who arrives on back of a good run; contender
runners.name: Victor The Rapid
runners.spotlight: Sole Hong Kong victory came over C&D; stepped up on some okay unplaced efforts when third to Genius Baby this month; that was his first start back in Class 4 since his C&D success; he can find trouble with his off-the-pace style of running but granted some luck, he should be in the mix.

runners.comment: Goes well here and capable off this mark; below his best in recent runs and that's a worry
runners.name: Lean Master
runners.owner: Cheng Wan Wai & Cheng Tsz Yan
runners.spotlight: Triple course winner (5f/6f), with all three coming at this level; seems best when prominent behind a good pace, which he should get here; current mark is within his capabilities but he has not run near to his best on his last three starts; a case can be made, but the doubts outweigh the positives.

runners.comment: Promise in two of three starts, which give him a shout; may shine best when trying 7f/1m
runners.name: Giant Ballon
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs George Chang And George Hing Chang
runners.spotlight: Made an eyecatching debut when fourth at Sha Tin (5f) in October, before folding quickly there last month; fared better on only C&D outing this month with a staying-on effort; he finished eighth but was beaten only 3l (Victor The Rapid third); by Mehmas and from the family of speedy Dramatised, but there are stouter elements in his maternal side and maybe he will thrive over further.

runners.comment: Sole win came at 7f; tends to find stride too late at 6f; lacks pace to exploit stall 1
runners.name: Giddy Up
runners.spotlight: Finished fast and late to land his only victory, a 7f event at Sha Tin in early 2024; placed just twice from ten outings over this distance, including a never-nearer third over C&D last time out; drawn 1 but needs to find more early zip if he is to capitalise on that.

runners.comment: Claims after breaking duck last time; 6lb higher mark and stall 12 are legitimate concerns
runners.name: Lakeshore Hero
runners.spotlight: Gained a first success at the 11th attempt on his most recent start, unleashing a strong run to collar reopposing Winning Money close home; he's 4lb worse in this time and swaps gate 2 for stall 12; claims but not as strong as others.

runners.comment: Hints of ability and looks the type to improve with time and distance; one for another day
runners.name: One Love
runners.spotlight: Glimmers of ability in two of his three starts; there is better to come from him and he is strengthening up all the time judged on his weight progression; ear plugs applied for the first time; pedigree suggests he should improve when moved up in trip.

runners.comment: Front-running maiden placed in four of five C&D runs; Zac Purton stays loyal; on shortlist
runners.name: Winning Money
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who can cut inside to lead on the rail; ended last campaign with a pair of narrow C&D defeats, and has continued that trend on his last two runs; he's 0-9 but placed four times from his five C&D runs; enjoys a 4lb pull with Lakeshore Hero for a half-length defeat; has run well since under Zac Purton who remains on board; on shortlist

runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co
runners.comment: Both wins came here (5f) but he's on long losing run and unplaced in all eight 6f outings
runners.name: Heroic Master

prev_owners.owner: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co

runners.spotlight: Earned both Hong Kong victories at this venue, but in 5f contests; they were in Class 3 but he's on a 25-race losing run; handicap mark has been in freefall but he's been unable to take advantage, other than a few place efforts (5f); when tackling this trip, he's finished unplaced in all eight attempts.

runners.comment: Likely to chase the pace and has three C&D wins; decent efforts last twice; place claims
runners.name: Golden Luck
runners.owner: Chan Kam Shing, Wu Kai Char Et Al
runners.spotlight: Expect to see him close up from the start; he's gained all three career wins over C&D, with a 48% rate of making the frame from 21 efforts; has performed well on last two outings but he faded late on last time; minor honours would be a decent outcome.

runners.comment: Nothing shown in four starts to warrant support but trainer does well with sprinting types
runners.name: Winning Cigar
runners.spotlight: Comes from good sprinting stock, which his trainer usually utilises to good effect; next to nothing by way of competitiveness in his four races; plenty to prove before he comes under close scrutiny.

runners.comment: Unplaced all 11 starts and no promise in four appearances this season; best passed over
runners.name: Speedy Trident
runners.spotlight: Unplaced on all 11 occasions he has raced in Hong Kong, including twice over C&D; zero encouragement in his four performances in the current campaign; hood removed but he showed little without one in the past.

runners.comment: Glimmers of ability in short career but not enough to consider him a player
runners.name: Master Resolute
runners.owner: Tony Lau Hon Kwan, Dominic Lai Et Al
runners.spotlight: Fledgling career has hinted vaguely at a little ability, but nowhere near enough from which a positive argument on his chance can be put forward.

runners.comment: Goes well here and has two C&D wins, too; penultimate run okay but plenty to prove
runners.name: Crystal Powerful

prev_owners.owner: L K Fernie, K Doak Et Al

runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner, with a pair of C&D triumphs on his CV; seven mostly emphatic defeats since his last win (off a 2lb higher mark), although penultimate effort was creditworthy in the context of this contest.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on all three Hong Kong starts; down in grade today; drawn wide
runners.name: Bigtime Generation
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on all three Hong Kong starts; will appreciate this ease in grade but is drawn wide and needs significant improvement.

runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Good fourth from stall 10 over C&D last month but has the same awkward draw today
runners.name: Fatal Blow
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when dropped to this grade last month, finishing fourth over C&D from stall 10; remains on a workable mark but has the same awkward draw today.

runners.comment: Placed four consecutive times before his narrow C&D win three weeks ago; up 5lb
runners.name: California Blitz

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.spotlight: Placed four consecutive times before clinging on from Know At Heart to prevail by a short head over C&D three weeks ago; 5lb higher today but ought to run his race again.

runners.comment: Showed some promise in a recent trial but is probably best watched on official debut
runners.name: Good Luck Happy
runners.owner: Siu Chak Wai, Siu Wai Chung & Siu Wing Kin
runners.spotlight: First foal from a multiple sprint winner; showed some promise in a recent trial but is probably best watched on official debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.comment: Made low-key debut when never-dangerous ninth at Sha Tin last month
runners.name: Precision Hope
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut when never-dangerous ninth at Sha Tin last month and needs to take a big step forward.

runners.comment: Kept on for fourth over C&D last month and remains unexposed after only two starts
runners.name: Winning Now
runners.spotlight: Showed some speed before fading on debut at Sha Tin in October and kept on for very respectable fourth over C&D last month; well drawn again today and could easily have more to offer.

runners.comment: Below best last time but well drawn again today; hard to beat if blinkers aid his cause
runners.name: Yee Cheong Spirit
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when only sixth here last month but is well drawn again today and was placed over C&D on consecutive outings beforehand; could be hard to beat if he responds well to first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Finished last on first two appearances and makes no appeal from stall 12
runners.name: Zhou Gongjin

prev_owners.owner: 24/25 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Finished last on first two appearances and makes no appeal from stall 12.

runners.comment: 0-9 in Hong Kong but ran big race from stall 12 when fifth here three weeks ago
runners.name: Call To Command
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in Hong Kong but ran big race from stall 12 before fading into fifth over C&D three weeks ago; 1lb lower and not drawn as wide today; can make his presence felt.

runners.breeder: Mrs C A & C C Chamberlain
runners.comment: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs; blinkers are now added
runners.name: Golden Brilliant
runners.spotlight: Yet to show anything more than minor promise after four runs and needs a good boost from the first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: 0-14 in HK but in good form this season and lost out only narrowly over C&D this month
runners.name: Know At Heart
runners.spotlight: 0-14 in Hong Kong but in good form this season and lost out by only a short head to California Blitz over C&D three weeks ago; shortlisted.

runners.comment: In the frame over C&D both outings this season and has a much better draw than last time
runners.name: Sonic Pursuit
runners.spotlight: A maiden after seven starts but made the frame over C&D on both outings this season, more recently when close fourth from stall 12 last month; has a better draw today; dangerous to ignore.

runners.comment: Kept on for sixth over C&D last Wednesday but remains without a win since September 2023
runners.name: Superb Boy
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mak Yiu Hay & Mak Kai Chung
runners.spotlight: Kept on for sixth over C&D last Wednesday but this regressive 7yo remains without a win since September 2023; others preferred.

runners.comment: Surprise C&D winner on debut in July but disappointing on both starts this season
runners.name: Lucky Twenty
runners.owner: 24/25 Jimmy K H Ting Trainer Syndicate
runners.spotlight: Rallied well to cause 61-1 surprise over C&D on debut in July but has disappointed on both starts this season; now sports blinkers; has a point to prove.

runners.comment: Began the season with two decent efforts at Sha Tin (1m2f) and is 1lb lower here
runners.name: Romantic Thor
runners.owner: Peter Lau Pak Fai & Suki Tang Xianfang

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

quotes.race: Boodles Raindance Dee Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was very pleasing. I thought Ryan gave Capulet a lovely ride. He appreciated the step up in trip, no doubt. He's an uncomplicated horse who travels well. The Derby and the French Derby are the first two races that come to mind. He gets a mile and two well and would probably get a mile and four the way he runs. We'll have the trials at the weekend and next week then Aidan will sit down with the lads and discuss it and we'll make a plan from there. Ryan was delighted, he said he got into a nice rhythm and is a very kind, well-balanced horse. He said he could step up, it wouldn't be a problem - Paul Smith, Coolmore representative.

runners.spotlight: 0-6 in Hong Kong but began this season with two very respectable sixths at Sha Tin (1m2f) and is 2lb lower here; no surprise if he features.

stable_tour.quote: He's good and forward and we're happy with him. He's another who will step into a Derby trial and he would like a bit of nice ground. Hopefully he can improve as he steps up further in trip and could get further than a mile and a half in time if we ask him to. 03-04-24

runners.comment: Completed 1m hat-trick in September and has remained in good form over 1m1f since
runners.name: Wrote A New Page
runners.owner: Sammy Ma Hon Kit & Ronald Ma Chun Ho
runners.spotlight: Completed 1m hat-trick when winning narrowly here on seasonal debut in September and has remained in good form over 1m1f since; major player if this new trip suits.

runners.comment: Front-runner; made the frame over 1m1f on all three starts this season; bold bid likely
runners.name: Liveandletlive

quotes.race: Betfred 'Bet Builder' Sankey Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I've always thought a lot of Liveandletlive. If he goes up high enough to get in the Britannia I'll take him to Ascot - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won over 1m2f at Sha Tin in May and has made the frame three consecutive times over 1m1f here this season; likely to make another bold bid over this new trip.

runners.comment: 0-9 in Hong Kong but has posted some good efforts in recent months; respected
runners.name: Snowfield
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in Hong Kong but has posted some good efforts in recent months, including a third at Sha Tin (1m2f) two starts ago; continues to edge down the weights and ought to be on the premises again.

runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.comment: Well beaten on dirt last time but C&D suits him well; too well handicapped to rule out
runners.name: Turin Mascot
runners.owner: Dr Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung, Ken Huang Jian Hua & Tsoi Huk Yam

prev_owners.owner: Tsoi Huk Yam, Sheldon Tse Hiu Tung & Ken Huang Jian Hua

quotes.race: Lengthen The Odds With BetVictor Race
quotes.quote: In Ecstasy is a progressive horse who enjoys the all-weather. We will have a look at heading back there in February for the Listed three-year-old race - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well beaten on dirt (1m) last month and not easy to predict nowadays but this C&D suits him well and he's too well handicapped to rule out.

runners.spotlight: Seems to have turned a corner on last two outings, more recently when keeping-on fourth at Sha Tin (1m1f) nine days ago; will probably be suited by this longer trip and Zac Purton takes the ride today; must be considered.

runners.spotlight: Well down the field on both appearances this season (1m2f) and has now been unplaced on all eight Hong Kong starts.

stable_tour.quote: We have a few possibles for the King Edward VII Stakes and this chap is one of them. He ran well in the Chester Vase and seems to have taken a nice jump forward from two to three.. 12-6-24

Ian Chan Yau Nam, Chan Wai Nam & Cyrus Chan Sing Kit

runners.owner: Bernie Yim Mei Fung & Yim Man Hay
runners.spotlight: Prevailed by a nose over C&D four weeks ago and is now 2-3 this season; latest 5lb rise demands more from him but he's evidently in very good nick.

runners.comment: Fourth at big odds over C&D last month and persistently denied clear run last time
runners.name: Symbol Of Strength

quotes.race: Unibet Sirenia Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It's nice to get our first Group race over the line since we came over here. I was nervous watching and could tell Symbol Of Strength hated the surface. It was very slow and the quicker the ground the better. Tom Marquand said when he got there he was having a look around and that there was plenty left in the tank so it's onwards and upwards. It will very much depend on the ground. He's in the Mill Reef and the Middle Park and all the doors are open to him now. We'll be looking closely at Newbury but his form is right up there with horses who are well up the pecking order for the Middle Park. I think we're entitled to be thinking about those races. I couldn't believe his price in the Gimcrack and couldn't stop backing him each-way. He's not just a two-year-old either and could get seven furlongs no problem - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: To say Symbol Of Strength was the outsider of the field at that price was ridiculous. It even had me doubting myself! He's a good horse who'll have no problem getting 7f, even a mile next year. He's plenty more scope and we think a lot of him. The sky's the limit and he's in the Mill Reef and will probably go there - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Group 3 AW winner when trained in Britain; unplaced all four Hong Kong starts but belied 73-1 odds when fourth over C&D last month and was persistently denied clear run when only tenth here last time; can go well from the inside stall.

runners.comment: Held his own in this higher grade after last month's Class 4 win; needs to kick on again
runners.name: Charming Babe
runners.spotlight: Won from stall 1 over C&D last month and kept on for respectable seventh when upped to this grade four weeks ago but needs to kick on again to succeed at this level.

runners.name: Lims Shavano

runners.name: Prestige Superior

prev_owners.owner: J D Micallef, Mrs T G Micallef Et Al

runners.spotlight: Won twice when based in Australia (6.5f/1m) but struggled when a big-priced outsider for Hong Kong debut in June and has not raced since.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Distant Seas was undone by the soft ground at Naas. Colin thought he was a lot more straightforward today. He loved that ground and Colin said that if he got the ground he would not be afraid of stepping up to the Round Tower in two weeks - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 3yo; made promising Hong Kong debut over 5f here in July but both 6f runs this season have been very underwhelming; tongue-tie added today.

runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when a 99-1 outsider for Hong Kong debut (7f) in March

quotes.race: La Celia Wines Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Arnaman had his first run in Dundalk and we found the same as the previous, that top of the ground suits him best. He mightn't have been in love with the ground but Billy picked the best of it and got the job done. He showed a bit of resolution and Billy said he'd be better with a lead. Ultimately, he'll join Robert Siong's team in Hong Kong as that's what he was bought for - Ken Condon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo who won a small-field 7f maiden in June 2024; struggled to get competitive when a 99-1 outsider for Hong Kong debut (7f) in March; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: All Too Brave

He deserved to get his head in front and he will get confidence from that. We think he is a horse who can hold his own in Group company as the season goes on. He'll probably go to Deauville in two weeks for a Group race. He handles a bit of juice but I think he would be fine on better ground too - Joseph O'Brien, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Reliant on a strong pace over this trip but was placed over C&D twice last month, more recently when very close second to King Miles; will warrant consideration if he gets a run today.

runners.comment: Back in prime form over 1m1f here recently and still on workable mark after 6lb rise

quotes.quote: We thought Indian Dream was a nice horse at the start of the year but his tackle ruined his head and he's coming on now since he's been gelded. He made hard work of it but kept staying on and should go on from this - Ian Smith, travelling head lad.

runners.spotlight: Seemingly back in prime form when winning with a bit left in the tank over 1m1f here a fortnight ago and remains on a workable mark after recent 6lb rise; high on the list.

runners.name: Soleil Fighter

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Handicap
quotes.quote: Ideally a really hard mile is what Connemara Coast wants, when he's almost off the bridle behind, and then he'll outstay them, but he'll definitely be a mile and quarter horse next season. He might go to the July meeting but Ryan thought there'd be an Ascot handicap for him at the end of the year. When they go flat out at Ascot it will be perfect for him - Richard Hughes, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four good runs this season, the latest a very close second at Sha Tin three weeks ago; holds no secrets from the handicapper but has very obvious each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He has never run a bad race in his six starts to date, which includes a win at Wolverhampton last autumn and at Sandown on his most recent outing. Ryan [Moore] won on him at the Esher track and it is always great to get him, but he is a man in serious demand and it is not that easy to get him on one of yours. He is now on a 3lb higher mark of 86 and the plan is to head back to either Newmarket for the July meeting next month where there is a three-year-old 0-95 mile handicap, or Ascot a day later for a 0-95 for three-year-olds. We will try to get Ryan again as he remains on a very workable mark. 29-06-23

quotes.race: Byerley Stud Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We're pleased with that. It's been 18 years since we had a runner here and we were second that day with a subsequent Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe winner [Dylan Thomas] We thought Cambridge had improved since his run at Roscommon. He ran very green but was more professional there, the winning margin wasn't much but it's all about winning and I'm glad we have - Kevin Buckley, owners' representative.

runners.spotlight: Ended last season in good form over 1m1f here but not much has gone to plan this term; needs to up his game.

runners.spotlight: Won at Longchamp in July (1m2f, good to soft) but not so good twice since; others appeal more.

runners.name: Bramans
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice before rattling home to beat Soeur over C&D three weeks ago; the handicapper has had his say but still likely to make a bold bid.

runners.spotlight: The winner of two of her 14 starts, both over 7f on the AW at Chantilly; runner-up over 7f here ten days ago, taking a while to pick up but finishing her race off well; high on the list.

runners.comment: 7th in two runs for new stable; Listed-placed in March (5.5f); stamina for 1500m a query
runners.name: Mehmist
runners.spotlight: Third in a Listed race at Chantilly (5.5f, very soft) in March; two runs for new stable have seen him finish seventh and although the latest run at Toulouse was respectable (6f, heavy; sent off at 89-1), his stamina for this trip looks questionable.

runners.comment: Made a winning stable debut in October; pulled hard but late headway at Chantilly latest
runners.name: Frankini
runners.spotlight: Recorded an RPR in the 70s in three runs for Andrew Balding; overcame racing freely to make a winning stable debut at Strasbourg (7.8f, heavy), making most and pulling well clear with the runner up; pulled hard early when well held at Chantilly earlier in the month but he was staying on in the closing stages; needs to settle better.

runners.comment: 3 AW wins (inc C&D) and won cosily at Chantilly this month (6.5f); new yard; key player
runners.name: Rosapenna

prev_owners.owner: Ian Douglas Highet & Mrs Robert G Ehrnrooth
Ian Douglas Highet & Haras De Bourgeauville
Ian Douglas Highet & Mrs Robert G Ehrnrooth

runners.spotlight: The winner of three of his nine starts (all wins on AW including C&D); strong favourite when landing a 6.5f claimer at Chantilly 17 days ago, staying on powerfully down the outside to win a shade cosily; good claims starting out for a new stable.

runners.comment: Three minor wins but struggled at big prices in two runs for this yard
runners.name: Sunrise Dream
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner at minor tracks but he has been well beaten at big odds in both starts for this stable.

runners.comment: Not shone in five runs for new stable
runners.name: Bobrovkha
runners.spotlight: Won a 6.5f maiden at Le Touquet in July but she hasn't made an impact in five runs for this stable.

runners.comment: Chance on best form but she was well beaten on her recent stable debut
runners.name: With Zest
runners.spotlight: Finished second in a Newmarket maiden (7f, soft) in one 2yo run for Sir Michael Stoute; won a fillies' maiden (1m, good) at Chantilly in April before a fair effort in a Listed race one month later; struggled in handicaps but did finish second in a Chantilly claimer in November; well-beaten 36-1 shot on her stable debut two weeks ago, however.

runners.comment: 6f win in Poland last year; struggling in France, including a claimer latest; new stable
runners.name: Sonadoor
runners.spotlight: 6f winner in Poland; eased when beaten in a 1m claimer at Chantilly last month (sent off a triple-figure price); change of stable needs to have a dramatic effect.

runners.breeder: S A R L Al Shiraaa Farms
runners.comment: 7f 2yo winner for W Greatrex; not at best in 2025 and sold 7,000gns in October; yard run 2
runners.name: Dear Cat
runners.owner: Richard Sam Hoskins, Kristian Strangeway & David Haddrell
runners.spotlight: 7f 2yo winner for Warren Greatrex; she looked in the handicapper's grip this year and was sold for 7,000gns in October; one of two runners for Francois Monfort.

runners.comment: Highly tried after her 2yo win; ran okay in a 1m AW handicap last time; not out of it
runners.name: Bravo Bay
runners.owner: Racing 53, Seror Racing Management Et Al
runners.spotlight: Highly tried after her 2yo win last June (7f, good to soft); ran her best race for her new connections when eighth in a 1m Chantilly handicap two weeks ago, making the running and not headed until inside the final furlong; not dismissed if building on that effort.

14:05.race_name: Prix Arcangues - Polytrack Challenge (Listed Race) (3yo+) (All-Weather Track) (Polytrack)

runners.comment: Smart in 2023; pleasing return from long absence last month; good chance
runners.name: West Wind Blows

quotes.race: TAB Champions Stakes (Group 1) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: West Wind Blows had to enter the barriers a couple of times and I'm not sure that helped. He was slow away and overall was disappointing - Jamie Spencer, rider.

quotes.race: Carlton Draught Caulfield Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was a fascinating visual seeing him [West Wind Blows] and Without A Fight battling it out at the finish. All credit to both horses because they're seriously good and it was a great spectacle. We took Without A Fight over for the Melbourne Cup last year. The ground was too soft then, but he went down there to stay there and that was the whole point of last year's trip. They're two tough horses ? it was fantastic to watch. It was a great run and West Wind Blows came close to winning. He was so close yet so far, but I'm very proud of him as he had to fight hard and it was a super effort - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Prix du Prince d'Orange (Group 3) (3yo) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We could be (tempted by the Arc), it's the championship race of the year, but we'll sit down with the owner and make a plan for West Wind Blows - Ed Crisford, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won two Group 3 events at Longchamp earlier in his career and had strong form in Australia in 2023; fair effort back from a long absence when second at Kempton seven weeks ago; needs serious consideration.

stable_tour.quote: He got loose behind the stalls before his intended run at Newbury but is fine after that and will go in a novice this week. We've always liked him and he did well over the winter, so I'd like to think that he'll be worth following when he steps up from 1m2f. 25-04-22

runners.breeder: M Bollack-Badel, Ecurie Noel Forgeard & P Lamy
runners.comment: Readily saw off Kliff Bere at Chantilly last month (13.5f, AW); more needed at this level
runners.name: Pentaour
runners.owner: Ecurie Noel Forgeard, Eirl Myriam Bollack-Badel Et Al
runners.spotlight: The winner of seven of his 38 starts, the latest a defeat of Kliff Bere in a conditions event at Chantilly (13.5f) five weeks ago; was well positioned on that occasion but he found plenty when asked; more required at this level though.

runners.comment: Won well on AW at Pornichet (15.5f) last month but unplaced in four previous Listed runs
runners.name: Raimondin
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; six wins from 18 starts, the latest a conditions event at Pornichet (15.5f, AW) where he came from well back in a race where the placed horses raced prominently; four runs in Listed company have seen him finish unplaced though.

runners.breeder: Haras De La Haie Neuve & Sas Regnier
runners.comment: C&D winner; chased home Pentaour at Chantilly five weeks ago; needs more to win
runners.name: Kliff Bere
runners.owner: Laurent Moutard, J-M Lefebvre Et Al
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; 0-9 this year but he has run some good races in defeat, including at Listed level; finished behind Pentaour at Chantilly five weeks ago and not sure to turn around that form.

runners.comment: 2-2 on AW, including C&D, but up in class after a 254-day break
runners.name: Foxtrot Zulu
runners.spotlight: Improved for a step up to middle distances, winning over C&D in February and at Chantilly (13.5f, AW); well held at Longchamp in her hat-trick bid in April, making the running, headed 2f out and weakening in the final furlong; up in class for her return to action and she will do well to maintain her unbeaten AW record.

runners.comment: Back to form returned to AW at Lingfield last month; needs more to take this though
runners.name: Sea Just In Time

quotes.race: Darley Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was nice. I thought Sea Just In Time did that well. We always thought she was nice and is well-rated, being a sister to Truthful and we had the older sister as well (Sea On Time) who sadly injured a tendon after winning a maiden when she looked nice. There is no rush to decide where she goes next, I'll leave that to William. I think she probably needs three weeks before she runs again and we could look for a Listed contest for her. There are lots of things later in the year like the Irish Oaks. Sea Of Class was second here before going on to win a Listed race and then on to win the Irish Oaks - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two wins for William Haggas last season; struggled on turf for David O'Meara this year but her latest fifth of 13 in a Lingfield fillies' Listed race (1m5f, AW) was more encouraging; unexposed on AW but needs a personal best to win.

stable_tour.quote: This time last year William Haggas was talking about her as his Oaks filly and when she's good, she's very good. She has two blemishes on her record as well, but on her novice wins she looks a stakes performer. The Nottinghamshire Oaks will be her first target. The Turnbull family bought her and will breed from her eventually and getting black type will be key. 14-04-25

runners.comment: Spanish-trained mare; latest 3rd in Toulouse Listed event needs bettering against males

runners.spotlight: Two Listed wins in Spain, the latest in June (12.5f, good); front-running third of 13 in a Listed race at Toulouse in October (1m4f, good to soft; finished behind two British-trained runners); that form appears to leave her with something to find today.

runners.comment: 0-9 this year but was Listed placed at Longchamp in May (1m6f, soft); others are stronger

runners.comment: Unplaced all six starts and looks an unlikely winner
